reviewText:
***THERE WILL BE FAPPING***

THIS GAME IS SO BAD, IT'S GOOD.

Ok, there, I've said it.
But OF COURSE, it's bad. It's from Troma.

WHO THE HELL IS TROMA?" you might ask yourself.

TROMA Entertainment.
The purveryors of crazy
voteText: hardcore
votesHelpful: action/scifi/horror/romance cult movies in the universe of B-movies. That's who. They even had a Saturday morning cartoon show at one point. Their fame stems mostly from the movie: "The Toxic Avenger"
commentsCount: and an assort of other movies
column16: with other characters that have developed large cult followings. They've been around for about 40 years now.\n\nSO now these guys have a PC game. ACTUALLY
column17: about 15 years ago; said they didn't release it then
column18:
figuring the game would get totally banned.

*Update: "DrSpikee" shared this was originally a 1999 Polish game called "Rezerwowe Psy"*.
Thanks dude! :D
It appears Troma was able to use it to make their own game. (seems minus the original sex/nudity!)

THE GAME:
Starts with a disclaimer; and Lloyd from Troma pointing out you don't need it: you already bought the effing game! LOL
column21: a collection of clips from their many old movies: gross
column24: with boobs in one scene (more on boobs later). There's the menu
column25: pretty straightforward. Start a New Game.\n\nThe game is an isometric
column28: squad-based shooter.\nYou start out with 3 dudes: The Toxic Avenger (Toxie)
column30:
and The Stranger.
Your goal: to wipe out the Surf Nazis (see the movie "Surf Nazis Must Die").

The game is very similar in handling to the original Fallout game
column31: but with complete emphasis on COMBAT only. Even the inventory menu looks inspired
column33: will find some familiarity. When you bag someone
column36: and their loot in a nice pile for you to pick-up through the inventory screen.\n\nEverything costs action points. Action points to walk
column39: to move things in your inventory even.\n\nThe game is divided into "missions". The level areas aren't big
column41: this is a pretty straightforward clean and sweep game: GO AND KILL ALL OF THE BAD GUYS.\n\nFrom this point
column42: that is all you do. There isn't anything to interact with
column43: but you can blow away all the different pedestrians with names with the likes of:  "Hooker"
column47: etc. Some will randomly draw weapons and shoot you. Shooting a "overworked office worker" might yield you some loot
column53: or whatever. Most of the loot appears to be just "novelty" items. The only things of value are any weapons/ammo they have. Like Fallout 1/2
column55: but there is no "karma" penalty in this game.\n\nYou can also target individual parts: legs
column57: or head. Just right cilck on the target to get a small menu with attack options. Works well.\nHowever
column58: it doesn't seem to really do anything. For example
column59: you can't blow off legs or heads.\nHaven't seen any animations other than the character falling to the ground
column60: and then a pool of blood appearing. I noticed when I shot someone with alot of strength still
column64:
and they were just lightly wounded.

I suspect this is probably something they never had time (or budget) to finish or properly implement.

To complete the missions
column65: you only have to snuff out the BAD GUYS (with various weapons).\nOnce that is done
column66: there is a "Thumbs Up" button that appears.\nClick it
column68: you are treated to the narrator telling the story.\nLOL. Man this is so bad. Sometimes
column71: shows the creators of South Park in a fake commercial about hermaphrodites. Another
column72: of Lemmy from Motorhead doing a weird PSA type thing. Another is a metal music video. Another is a montage of super-gory moments from Troma movies.\n\n(**NOTE
column73: you will miss these if you "left-click". I tried "right-clicking" and then they played. However
column74:
the game glitched-out when the next level started.)

Graphics:
Not bad for a game 15 years old. There isn't anything to interact with
column75: there isn't a load of detail in the hand-painted backgrounds/levels
column76:
but the areas are diverse and seem to look better as you progress. The animations were good.

Sound:
The sound FX are alright
column79: but was rare and only in an instant.\nA couple of sounds
column80: seem to be right out of Fallout
column81: like when reloading or messing with the menu. Hmmm. When you kill someone
column82: they let out a really long
column83: over-the-top blood-curdling scream. The characters/NPCs will make funny comments or noises at times. Like
column84: Toxie might run out of action points while trying to go somewhere you told him to
column85: and will stop and say something like:"Yeah
column86: I'll get to it as soon as I finish taking my toxic waste dump!"\n\nMusic: Varies
column88: to alot of  SKA and METAL
column89:
with R or X rated lyrics. It's like they couldn't afford GWAR and got some other bands who weren't as extreme. The narrator might pop-in once in a while to give a game hint. Whatever.

PROS:
-Straight-forward
column91:
dark humor
-Interface design is simple and efficient at the same time
-Novelty of playing classic cult characters from the TROMA movies and fighting other characters from the movies
-If you like games like POSTAL
column92:
you'll feel right at home

-the game proudly doesn't take itself seriously

column94: where you get a bunch of "behind-the-scenes" stuff. A lot of blood
column96: and booty. There is a whole section of the "Tromettes"
column98:
naked/scantly-dressed chicks in sexy or PORN-Y poses.

CONS:
-Seems like you never get enough action points to do things
-Some lite-RPG elements would have been nice
-Inventory system is glitchy as heck!!!! I recommend when clicking an inventory/ground object
column99: to click REAL FAST (tap) and do this in the upper-left corner of the object. Glitchy inventory system can cause you to easily pick-up/put-down an object costing you valuable Action points\n-How managing your inventory is never explained well. For example
column100: took awhile to figure out character's "backpacks" can hold seemingly infinite amount of items!!\n-For a "Troma" game
column101: it greatly lacks the gore; it feels dare I say: unfinished? Fallout
column104: and just many others games even from that time
column106: gorier. So this was a disappointment.\n-Sometimes
column107:
you'll spend TOO MUCH time hunting for that ONE LAST ENEMY on the map
-Game mouse-scroll is way too fast and there is no way to use the keys or to slow it down
-Wished the world was more detailed and fleshed out
-Rough around some edges

MAYBE:
-Permadeath! If one of your first 3 guys gets wasted
column108: they're OUT.\nYou advance into the next missions with whoever survived. OR
column109: if you can reload from your last saved (you can save whenever)\nSome people will like this
column110: some will not. So far with my game
column111: I got a hot chick added in one mission.\n-Doesn't seem to be anyway to restore health during a mission
column112: so might be too challenging for some.\n-Sick
column113: Troma style humor isn't for everyone (gosh

it's not an RPG or even some big epic game.
AND DON'T TAKE IT SERIOUSLY!
You go out and kill the bad guys (and whoever else). That's it.
It would be interesting if they make a new game where they implement more things to do

reviewText:
It's a bad-looking turn based strategy, like the combat in old Fallouts (and possibly XCOM, but I could never get into those games) made 15 years ago, that must've felt cheap and old even back then. However, the upsides are:

- Full of crude, sexual jokes!
- Narrated by Lloyd Kaufman himself!
- Toxie, Sgt. Kabukiman and some other weird guy take on the Surf Nazis!
- Loud, trashy soundtrack! Including Nevermore. In fact, I was suspecting the game was playing stuff it found on my hard drive, until I saw the Nevermore logo while exiting the game.

- There's a /BonerMaterial/ folder in the game's directory, which contains a video, some music and pictures of hot tromettes among other things.
- I recommend reading the manual, and it's not because it will help you with the game.

I suck at the game but hey, it's tromazing!

Sloth Academy verdict:
rating: 5 mutated radioactive cretin sloths

special awards:
most exclamation marks!
distinguished medal for not giving up the fight for truly independent vidya
voteText: 26 of 29 people (90%) found this review helpful 8 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Do you really love Troma? If not, pass on this.
Can you stand or do you enjoy the gameplay of the Fallout and/or Crusader games? If not, pass on this.
Can you forgive a game for being obviously made around 1999 and for having numerous glaring faults? If not, pass on this.

For everyone else, this is truly the gaming equivalent of a Troma movie, narrated by Lloyd himself and featuring music and clips pulled from Troma's vast library. This is so not a game for everyone, but really would it be a true Troma game if it was?

My main gripes: It feels overly difficult. Combat's clunky, and the gameplay can be really non-intuitive, especially menu interaction and item interaction.

Beyond that... I feel I got what I'd expect from a game from one of my favorite film companies.
voteText: 17 of 17 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Growing up I became quite familiar with Troma movies. Our trips to the video store would often end with one of us bringing home Class of Nuke 'Em High" or "The Toxic Avenger"
date: or another oddball Troma film. The AAA movies were usually picked over (this was before a dozen copies of the same movie existed at one place) and nobody wanted the piece of ♥♥♥♥ Troma movies that were always lurking in the horror section. They were cheap
hoursPlayed: and they horrified clean-cut tight-♥♥♥ ultra-orthodox families. In other words: these movies were made for degenerates like me.\n\nThe best way to describe a Troma movie is by imagining a steaming turd left to sautee in a vat of brown toilet water in a public restroom and occasionally puked on for a month. After that they take it out with a pair of pincers and dip it in fondue
voteText:
then sprinkle it with confetti and truffle oil. It's Trash folks. But it's gold-encrusted trash made by sick-minded filmmakers for trash-loving fans; and when you grow up with that kind of art you learn to appreciate it like a fine French wine.

Lloyd Kaufman and Michael Herz really tapped into something original when they started making these movies. I mean how do you categorize a film that has a handicapped kid getting slaughtered for points or a buxom beauty getting her butt burned by a mutated monster? A buffet of violence complimented by rock 'n roll music and sexual humor? This is the wonderful world of Tromaville and it is clearly a genre of its own.

The video game is your basic RTS without the advanced tactics stuff. Honestly I could only stomach a short play. But its full of violence
votesTotal: and classic Troma songs (which can also be found as MP3s in the root folder). So what am I complaining about?"

reviewText:
X-Com meets Tromaville. I like both so I enjoy this one. If you are not a fan of turned based games and or the Troma movies, then this game isn't for you.

I only played the first two missions so far, but it is fun. Control Toxie, Sargent Kabukiman and a new character the stranger and show why Surf Nazis musst die!

Loyd Kaufmans narration is great, and the soundtrack is nice too (It consists of the soundtracks of the movies, and various metal and punk music, very fitting and fun to listen too, again if you enjoy that type of music). There is also plenty of Troma movie clips. Again highly recommended if you like turned based tactics like X-Com/Fallout/Jagged Alliance and if you like Troma.

reviewText: Please buy this, because the more money you give to Troma, the more projects Troma can undertake. That means Troma people will be able to live in TromaWorld for a while longer, and not in the real world.....and trust me, this is a win-win for everybody(Do you really want to see Uncle Lloyd wandering down your street???....Yeah, that's what I thought).\nAs a 15 year old RPG, it is certainly acceptable, had a struggle getting the game to start the first time I tried to play it, second time it was fine. Taking items from fallen enemies could be a little easier, controls aren't as easy as they could be, but once you get the hang of it, the game does work, and it is fun enough I will be playing more

reviewText: Admittadly not the best programmed game. There are several bugs that have yet to be resolved. However, I must say that, as a fan of Troma and The Toxic Avenger, I couldn't help but enjoy myself. It has a wonderfully twisted sense of humor that is iconic with the studio and also has all the characters we know and love from its films. Everything from Toxie to Poltrugiest is here. If you are a fan of the Troma films and are looking for a good nostalgia trip, I'd highly reccomend this game. If you've never watched a single Troma film, nor do you intend to, I'd advise you play the original Grand Theft Auto instead.

reviewText:
-Is this game bad?
yes but...no
- Is it functional?
yes.
-Is the game play hard?
Nope. Similar to X-Com. Or the game they made for the movie Night Watch.
(I know Night Watch is obscure but I wish was on steam because it was a decent game.)
-Is it buggy?
yes, but nothing game breaking just annoying.
-Does it have Toxic Avenger and Sgt. Kabukiman N.Y.P.D.?
Oh yes.
-FMV Nudity?
yep.
-Is it fun or am I having fun?
Yes in a weird way even though its terrible. I just wanted to finish each level just to hear what Lloyd would say next or what cool new video I unlocked. After a while I realized,This isn't so bad.".
If you are not a troma fan you may not want to buy this game. But.... for 2 bucks you may want to go to netflix and watch as many Troma films as you can and then buy this game. This is only if you are into horror/slap stick comedy that is extremely offensive.

Should I buy this?
Yes. Just know what you are getting into ahead of time."

reviewText: I'll quote from Lloyd Kaufman's book, Direct Your Own Damn Movie:\n\nEven though I remain one of the few true American film auteurs
date: a fact recognized by Japanese sensation Takashi Miike-director of such brilliant films as Ichi The Killer and Audition- I refuse to have any of my films labeled as 'A Film By...' or 'A Lloyd Kaufman Film.' Although I do maintain strict control over each film
recommended: filmaking is far too collaborative an undertaking for me to claim full responsibility for the end result. And besides
hoursPlayed: I hardly consider myself worthy to stand alongside such giants as Sergei Eisenstein and Orson Welles."\n\nTrue Troma fanatics will know these words without ever having read them--There is so much beyond creating something that creates money. There is a drive to push your ideas out as quickly and as cheaply as possible
voteText: because time is short and the ideas are flowing. . . Put the top film characters representing Heroes into a video game; Where's my cast list?; Who is catering the project Kevin is directing? Does anyone know where the nude Lizard Ladies went? How long until we can get 500 copies of the latest Guiseppe Andrews film?\n\nBUY TROMA!"
